text:
GoDaddy empowers over
21 million customers

entrusting us with over
82 million domain names.
When we started the journey
with AWS in 2018, we moved a lot
of workloads out into the cloud,

and then we started wanting
to optimize those workloads,
becoming more cost efficient.

And so we started talking to
AWS about the possibility of
how do we start moving

and migrating some of our
workloads over to Graviton?

And we started working
with service teams at AWS

to figure out a strategy
around the migrations.

Working with AWS experts is
really essential for our teams
to be able to move faster towards

utilizing new services and
capabilities like Graviton.
They bring to the table the experience

and knowledge that we
may not necessarily have
directly within our teams.
One of the great things about working
with AWS Professional Services
and the AWS service teams is
it kind of becomes an extension
of your team. So that gives us the ability
to then move faster and innovate.
AWS helps upskill our team

by bringing in-house some
of the technologies, plus

specific expertise
that our teams don't have.
Giving us tools like Skill Builder
to enhance learning opportunities
that we can use
to then extend our own in-house skillset.

We've migrated hundreds of
workloads at this point.

We realized around 40%
savings in workloads

that moved over to Graviton
compared to x86 before.
And on the performance side,
we realized optimizations of 20%+

when you look at a
price to performance ratio.
It gives us that ability to
then free up some of the budget
that we used on those workloads
that were running on x86 previously

to then invest into other
capabilities and services.
